newsitem.title: CANADA: ConAgra Grain Canada plans C$10 mln elevator.
newsitem.headline: ConAgra Grain Canada plans C$10 mln elevator.

text.p: ConAgra Grain Canada said on Thursday it planned to build a C$10 million grain handling facility in southwestern Manitoba.

"We want a source of high quality grains and oilseeds to meet our needs, and southwestern Manitoba is a great location to obtain top product," ConAgra Grain Canada president Mayo Schmidt told a news conference.
The Brandon-Souris, Manitoba area facility should be completed in time for the 1998 harvest. It will be able to handle 10 million bushels of grain a year and spot a 100-car train within 10 hours.
ConAgra Grain Canada is a unit of Nebraska-based ConAgra Inc.
